comment: This class was such an easy A. Very simple class, which was very nice being a pre-nursing student. The only grades were 8 discussion posts and quizzes. They were very easy, you have more than enough time to turn everything in on time. Never directly contacted the professor, but the class is so easy & self-explanatory, you won't have to contact him.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: 6 quizzes, 6 discussions, one 8-12 page research paper. Loved the lectures & the books he assigned had very interesting historical information. Class starts 3 weeks late and beware during midterms, there was 400 pages to read! TOUGH grader, but I learned a heck of a lot. Not an easy A by any stretch.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Takes a while to grade but class is soooo easy.

He's a nice guy. Has a no laptop policy (but didn't really enforce it). No online notes or anything, just note outlines that he follows in class and explains in more detail, so the lectures are necessary if you don't want to read the textbook, or study outside of class. Not too hard.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Pieper is cool but he is heavy on lectures. Only 3 exams, all online. SHOW UP, TAKE NOTES, ASK QUESTIONS! He does not post PowerPoints, so unless you have a friend who can help you on a day of absence you are screwed
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He does not post notes so attend class to understand the outline. Pay close attention to the lecture and slides because some of them may be on the test but are not on the outline. Only graded by three tests with no final.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Took American Gov. with Prof. Pieper over the summer (maymester). Outstanding course. Attendance is required, but as long as you show up and pay attention, you should do well. Great lectures and very attentive to questions!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Inspirational

comment: I had his 8 am class and struggled to get out of bed to make  it. Attendance is very mandatory! if you miss 9 or more classes he fails you out of the class. every 2 days missed is 1 point off ur grade so GO TO CLASS. But only 3 exams, not difficult. each exam is 33% of ur grade so do good! don't take a morning class if u like your sleep.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I've taken Dr. Pieper twice and liked his class both times.  Online modules due every two weeks and a term paper at the end of the semester (I recommend communicating with him a LOT over this essay it really helped me).  Just pay close attention to the lecture videos and care about you're writing and you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: His class is mandatory and he is very funny. He also cares a lot about POLS.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment:
I took this class as a Maymester so your mileage may vary.

The class was very lecture heavy, I mean exclusively lectures. They're good lectures, he's an interesting speaker, but it was still just lectures.

Believe him when he says the tests are way more based on his lectures than the content in the books.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. P is a solid professor. The class is straightforward with biweekly quizzes and discussion posts. The book isnt necessary but close attention to the lectures is key for quizzes/posts. There is a long paper worth 60% but is not bad at all. Not an easy A, but worth the effort.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Great professor! It is a lecture heavy class, and it may be boring for someone, but I liked the way he did them. He graded by only 3 exams(1/3 of a grade each), so if you fail one exam, it's gonna ruin your grade. However, you can boost your grade if you take a final makeup exam. Attendance is not mandatory.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was stupid. Biweekly modules sounds great but only 6 quizzes and 6 discussions over the semester. One long paper thats 12+ pages and doesnt have to be related to the class really. I did poorly on one quiz and it ruined my entire grade. This crap sucked. First C and Im a senior. Do not take this class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I took this class due to the good ratings on this website and was thoroughly disappointed. This was the worse grade Ive ever received in my life. Only 6 tests and 6 discussion due on random Fridays (no set schedule) and the final paper which is 40 percent of your grade is graded with a literal iron fist. Would never take this class again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Maybe its just because I hate politics but this class sucked. He is very lecture heavy, and goes on rants about each slide of the PowerPoint. Theres only 3 test which arent that hard but you have to do good on them because thats all there is to your grade. It wasnt hard just boring. DO NOT take it 8 am though, youll regret it if you do
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Fantastic Professor. The class is graded on three tests and I made above a 90 on them all easily.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I was afraid to take this class since it was asynchronous but I don't regret it! His lectures are straightforward and you don't really need the textbook, in my opinion. The only grades are 3 exams, which isn't too bad. The exams aren't hard, you just have to listen to what he says and review before exams. Take him(:
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: I enjoyed Andrews class. The modules were pretty straight forward. If you did the modules you typically received good grades on the quizzes and discussion posts. There is a semester paper due at the end of the class that is a hefty chunk of your grade. He was very understanding of peoples concerns for Covid.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Overall - solid professor. His weekly assignments can only be done if you listen to the lectures. His lectures are pretty interesting too so you won't get bored easily unless you just hate politics. The Final is tough but he gives a decent amount of creative freedom. The textbook is required but I only really used it week 1
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Pieper is the best! He is so knowledgable and so kind. You definitely need to read in this class and watch the lectures, but he's great at making them interesting. I learned so much through his class without having to struggle or neglect my other classes. Highly recommend him!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: very easy class if you show up to class and take notes. Skipping class will destroy your grade. Would take again
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Pieper has an enjoyable personality for an 8AM. Has 3 tests, no cumulative exam. I made a B without reading the textbook, taking notes during lecture, being cognisant in class. 'Bonus participation/attendance points' were not added and he never actually checked difficult test questions for credit. Not a boring lecturer.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Peiper is super nice. He really knows his stuff, but he only lectures. Buy or rent the book because most of what is on the test is in the book. He posts outlines for his Powerpoint that you can just print off. His tests were online. Participation did count as part of the grade. He is easy to get in touch with outside of class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Professor Pieper is really nice and knowledgeable, but to get a good grade you need to read the entire textbook, because the study guide and outlines are just not enough. There isn't really any point in going to the lectures, except for attendance.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: There are three tests all online, that and attendance is your only grades. He says textbook required but i never used it, information on the test is straight from lectures. So if u go to class its an easy A

I thoroughly enjoyed this professor. He has 3 exams which are not cumulative. His class is lecture heavy so if you can get through that then you'll get an easy A. As long as you show up, you'll be fine. He only allows 2 absences so that stinks. Also, the book helps because majority of the test questions come from it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: This class has been one of my favorites! While the subject is very easy to get, he makes his lectures very interesting and funny. Three tests, non-cumulative are the only grades you have. He will take points off after some absences. Just go to class and pay attention and you should be fine!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: A very interesting class that goes by quickly if you are at all interested in the material. There are only three grades in the class. Three tests, one being the non-cumulative final. While it is easy to slack off until the tests appear, some of the test questions seem to appear out of nowhere. A Respectful and smart prof who wants you more informed
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. Pieper is an awesome professor. I took him for The Congress. Has personal experience in politics, makes everything interesting, and just an overall fun professor. A true diamond in the rough at Kennesaw State. My only gripe is that I can't take him for other classes lol.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Pieper put a "10 points off" stipulation in the final assignment section (40% of final grade) at the end of the syllabus which specified that topics for the final assignment needed to be submitted a month early (in a 2 month Summer session). And then he never said a word about it all semester.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof. Pieper is a really great professor! His lectures are a little boring but he tries his best to make the best of them. Attendance is mandatory, you only get two excused absences. After that, you lose a point for every class you miss. 3 grades in class only and they are 3 tests online. No textbook needed, all outlines are on d2l
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: We get textbooks, but the tests are mainly over the notes in class.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: he has 3 tests with curves. Tests are inspired by the book and lectures. If you star important things he talks about in class or graphs he shows you then you will be fine. I only studied for 2 nights before the test.  He is an excellent lecture so notes were easy. studying the vocabulary is critical
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Only 3 tests. The final is the last test but they are all pretty difficult cause there is so much information on them. Tests are kinda hard because he only gives you an outline of what to study and you have to teach yourself everything on the outline.

Just lectures and four paper tests. Dr. Pieper is great at taking advanced political ideas and presenting them in a format appropriate for a 1k level class. His tests can be difficult, but covers 100% of the information in class. He has a very cerebral sense of humour. Encourages questions and discussion. Quite neutral and unbiased.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Pieper is awesome. I was nervous to take any pols class because the professors are usually opinionated and biased, but his lectures are very straight forward and fact-focused.  He allows everyone to give input and listens to what you have to say. He encourages you to bring questions to him during office hours. 3 exams for entire grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: This was a good class. While the lectures could get boring and long, Pieper did his best to make the class funny and interesting. The majority of  the lectures are from the students, as we were put into groups to discuss the weekly readings, and that isn't for some people. If are just looking for a class to get Pols out of the way, this is it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. Pieper is a very good teacher. I imagine teaching POL SCI can be difficult, wrangling all different opinions, but he does an excellent job of making sure every one has a chance for their voice to be heard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Pieper is a really funny and cool professor. He's pretty laid back, but is set with his rules and teaching manner. Be prepared to sit and listen to pretty boring lectures. He does his best to make it as enjoyable as possible. The toughest part of this class is the fact that there are only 3 exams and that is your entire grade. Take notes!!

Maymester: I took AP Gov and made a 3, making his lectures redundant and boring. It was miserable. He let out early a lot though. 3 test and 3 boring documentaries. 1st test was a breeze, other two were much harder. He gives points back for popularly missed questions but doesn't tell you which ones. IF your grade is on the line, write the paper!

Dr. Pieper is fantastic. Clear, efficient and always up for answering questions and clarifying anything that you don't understand. If you take detailed notes from the powerpoint and his lectures and be sure to read through them before tests you will do well.
He is a brilliant guy and does a great job teaching from an unbiased perspective. Made me want to be more informed and know more about politics. Loved his dry humor too hah!

I loved this class!!! All you have to do the entire semester is three essays and three pop quiz essays. Dr. P's lectures are really interesting. He likes to talk about relevant, interesting topics and get the class talking. I would take him again. Also, no textbook!

Dr. Pieper is an outstanding professor. He works hard to make you think logically about the different parts of American government. But, this class isn't easy;  your entire grade rests on 3 research papers, 3 pop essays, and attendance. However, if you want to learn more about government without being spoon-fed info, then take him- it's worth it.

I took this as a maymester - takes a lot of time investment and work, but it is over in 10 days! He let out early a lot, gave us printable note outlines, and the notes filled in from lecture were almost identical to his tests. He encouraged discussions and really made you think. Nice and funny guy... Very glad I took the course with him.

I took this course as a Maymester, and yeah we went through like 3 chapters sometimes in a 3hr lecture class but in 10days it was over! So worth it: 3 online quizzes, 3 videos, and you're done! No textbook required, stay awake- a lot of his questions come from things he's said from his notes which you can print off D2L. Most days we got out early.

Seriously, the toughest class I've taken since beginning college. BUT he is an awesome professor and really works with you to clear up confusion and get you moving in a direction without doing the work for you. The papers are intense. You have to put in a lot of effort to get a good grade on those, and the final was pretty brutal. Great teacher.

I LOVED this class! i was in the honors section. We were split into groups and each group was in charge of leading group discussion for a class based on readings given to us. No tests, only 3 papers including a final. The professor let us learn on own but helped us with major concepts. I learned so much. He's a great professor!! Also:no textbook

Dr. Pieper is probably one of the best instructors I've had at KSU. He's a pretty easy going guy so long as you do the work that's expected of you. His classes are interesting and informative. The grading on his papers is a little tough, but he gives out a guide at the beginning of his course of his pet peeves. Follow it and you'll be OK.
I had him for maymester and he was awesome! I took good notes and he let class out early on most days. Tests are all online too. I would recommend him!

I took Dr.P for maymester and he was phenomenal! He was thorough and really made this class less stressful. 3 online test and 3 films. That's it! Honestly, if you are good at taking notes, then don't purchase the book. I made an A just by taking good notes. 1 paper and it's super easy. Would definitely recommend :)

Terrible course! I took thorough lecture notes but on tests I wonder where he got some questions. The one paper was pretty much opinion based but his grading was a little harsh, probably because we don't have similar political views. Boring lectures. Mandatory attendance that WILL affect your grade. Overall, would not recommend this professor!

I was in the honors section. 1 research paper and 3 online tests. I don't see why these reviews say he is hard. Great teacher, answers any questions you have, and you watch 3 movies throughout the semester. Attendance is mandatory but he lets class out early most of the time. I would take him again but I hate political science

I took him for the maymester and he was AWESOME! He made political science quick and painless. We watched 3 movies and there were only 3 tests. Just take notes and study and you'll do fine in his class! The tests are online as well

Great teacher extremely easy pay attention take a few notes, print the outlines out and you'll pass the test. I came out of the class with an A. A few reviews say his test are tricky I don't understand why the test are word for word from his notes.

Good teacher I never took notes and got a high B on every test. If you pay attention most of the question for the test are straight from his slides and class discussions. Overall very very easy class.

Mr. Pieper is a great guy, but his tests are pretty hard and have only an hour to do. This doesn't seem like it would be difficult, but a little less than half the questions do not go back to class related discussion. He is also a stickler to not giving extra credit whatsoever.

I like Dr. Pieper. But, he is the hardest professor I have had. I worked really hard and got a B, but he does tell you at the beginning this is a hard class and a B is an accomplishment. I think he's so hard because he wants his students to learn something and be successful later. So even though he gave me a B, I am taking another class of his.

Pieper is awesome. Lectures are interesting, and he always ends early. He had 2 tests which are essay format and not easy, and a term paper broken down into a proposal, outline, and the actual paper. Beware of writing at the last minute tho, he is the toughest grader I've had at KSU when it comes to term papers. I say take the class.
Research Methods sucks to take and to teach but Dr. P makes it tolerable! He is a wonderful professor and I highly suggest taking him for any course he teaches, you won't regret it!

I don't think his grading is entirely fair, he is somewhat unclear on what he wants. 2 tests and a paper that is divided into three parts. Takes attendance. Lecture is boring. Not a super hard class though, probably getting a B.

Nice guy who knows his stuff.  Just a few tests, but everything comes directly from your notes.  Sometimes you will take so many notes that you feel like your hand is going to fall off!  Come to class, pay attention, and take good notes, and you'll get an A or B.
Great professor. He makes the class as interesting as possible. He is a funny guy. The class is pretty straight forward. Exams are online.

Boring class, I fell asleep during lectures. 3 test online and one paper. Tests are extremely difficult and designed to trick you. Did not use book once. Attendance mandatory or your grade is docked. I would NOT take again.

Gives outlines of lectures on vista. Come to class fill those in. All tests are online. One project that is a paper, not hard! Tests are fairly easy! lectures can be boring, but overall good easy class!

Great professor, lectures can sometimes be a little boring, but he did play 2 movies over the whole semester to liven things up (Recount and 13 Days) Political related movie but got pretty interesting to watch.  Overall, great classroom clarity, handling of other POV as well. Grading is  not really typical, 3 tests, 1 project, that's it.

Great professor. Very clear lectures with outlines posted online. The test questions come straight from the notes. He is very knowledgeable about what he teaches and is willing to help if you don't understand.

One of the most difficult professors I've had thus far. I have made 2 B's in my three years at KSU and Pieper's class was one of them. He is a STICKLER for writing and grades papers a good 10 points lower than any other professor I've had. Good at what he does, but TOUGH.
Great Professor, really knows what he's talking about. Essays were hard, but he would edit them and then we would get to fix them for another grade. Plus he's hot.

Pieper is a great Professor. Some students complain he is hard but his test come straight from his lectures I never looked at my book, all I did was study my notes. He post an outline online and all test are online The class consists of 4 grades 3 exams and a paper If you miss more than 2 classes he will take a percentage point off grade go2class=A

GO TO CLASS IN ORDER TO PASS. He lectures the full time every class. Tests are very difficult sometimes unclear. One paper which is easy. All tests are online. Attendance is mandatory. I would not take him again. However, if you go to class and study you'll do decent.
Take him! Tests are online, except for final. You have to write one paper but thats it! I completely recommend him! :]
He was really hard!  Lecturede all day and he only had 3 tests and 2 papers.  Tests were really hard and for the first 2 tests, the whole class got an 82 or below!  Do not take.

Pieper is an excellent teacher! He makes sure he brings up points from both sides of an argument and is very good at not being biased. He has 4 tests, 1 paper, attendance is mandatory, and every day starts with discussion about whatever you want to talk about. His classes are pretty interesting, even if politics bore you. Oh yeah, and he's HOT!!

First of all-HOTTIE! It is definitely easier to pay attention when the teacher is a looker. Posts powerpoint lectures. Tests come from lectures so must come to class. Never opened my book and came off with a A. I wouldn't say he's easy, but he helps you when you have issues. Lots of class discussion as well so read vista posts!
Excellent professor!

I've learned alot from him regarding american government. However, on our first test on a class of over 100, the average grade was 60. His questions were just worded very tricky, you had 4 questions and one word separated the difference between it being right and wrong. The tests are multiple choice. Good teacher, difficult wording on tests.

good teacher, sometimes can get a little confusing if you don't pay attention.  Two papers, two tests. MUST study for the tests! He is willing to spend time and help if it is needed.  never pushes his views and is very open to discussion and questions.  great personality, easy class.  Can be a little boring sometimes. I would recomend this class!
